channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says he's confident of a deal ahead of Xi meeting
item.description: President Trump has confidently predicted striking a deal with China's leader, who he's set to meet Thursday.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa leaves Jamaica devastated. And, the shutdown's impact on airports
item.description: Officials are assessing the damage after Hurricane Melissa made landfall in Jamaica as a Category 5. And, how the government shutdown is impacting air...

item.title: Love or hate chain restaurants? We want to hear your story
item.description: America loves chain restaurants. NPR reporters Alana Wise and Jaclyn Diaz explore why.

item.title: An Alzheimer's pill appears to protect some in a high-risk population
item.description: A new study is reviving hope that a twice-daily pill can slow down Alzheimer's in people whose genes put them at high risk for the disease.

item.title: This furloughed IRS lawyer is living out his dream of being a hot dog vendor
item.description: While on furlough, Isaac Stein is fulfilling a childhood dream and passion project as a hot dog vendor.

item.title: Woman saved after slipping while boarding a moving train
item.description: Video released by India’s Southern Railways shows the moment a woman nearly fell in between a moving train and a station platform.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Gaza kill 104, health ministry says, after Hamas accused of killing soldier
item.description: US President Trump says "nothing" will jeopardise the two-week-old ceasefire despite the flare-up of violence.

item.title: Elderly woman found dead after being left on Great Barrier Reef island
item.description: The Coral Adventurer's crew realised the 80-year-old Australian was missing several hours after they had departed Lizard Island on the Great Barrier R...

item.title: Raid on gang in Rio leaves at least 64 people dead, including police officers
item.description: The police operation was one of the most violent in Brazil's recent history, with human rights organizations calling for investigations into the death...

item.title: Trump seems to acknowledge he can't run for a third term: "It's too bad"
item.description: President Trump appeared to concede Wednesday that he's not allowed to run for reelection in 2028, after teasing the idea on and off for months.

item.title: Federal trial to start over Trump’s efforts to deploy the National Guard in Portland, Oregon
item.description: A federal trial over whether President Donald Trump can deploy the National Guard to Portland, Oregon, is set to begin Wednesday.

item.title: "Extremely dangerous" Hurricane Melissa lashing Cuba after pounding Jamaica
item.description: Hurricane Melissa made landfall over eastern Cuba early Wednesday as an "extremely dangerous" Category 3 storm, forecasters said, after pummeling Jama...

item.title: 9/24: CBS Morning News
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel returns to air after suspension; CBS News speaks with leading researcher about White House autism claims.

item.title: Tight race in Dutch election as anti-Islam populist Wilders' hope of power declines
item.description: Wilders was the clear winner last time Dutch voters went to the polls in November 2023, but this time the race is far tighter.

item.title: Jamaicans wake to devastation as hurricane causes floods, power cuts and splits city in two
item.description: With communication networks in Jamaica crippled, the true scale of the disaster remains unknown.

item.title: Hometown of jailed drug lord hit by drones, forcing residents to flee
item.description: Cartels and other criminal organizations in Mexico have increasingly used drones in attacks against rival groups or authorities.

item.title: Judge orders daily meetings with Border Patrol official Bovino on Chicago immigration crackdown
Court disqualifies Trump-appointed US attorney from overseeing multiple criminal cases
